summary: U.S. Customs and Border Protection processes millions of imported shipments. When the COVID-19 pandemic began, imports briefly declined but then rose sharply, partly due to more online shopping and orders for supplies like masks. CBP took steps to maintain operations and minimize staff exposure to COVID-19 during the pandemic. For example, CBP implemented social distancing and required staff to use personal protective equipment. Also, certain...
title: COVID-19: CBP Acted to Mitigate Challenges Affecting Its Trade Operations
